results.title: Black eye
results.creator_credit: Pat Rooney Production, Pat Rooney and Jack Arnold
results.brief_description: Since being forced to give up his police badge following a suspension from duties, Shep Stone (Fred Williamson) has tried his hand at P.I work. Arriving home to his apartment one evening Stone finds a murder victim, and a killer waiting. Cast includes Fred Williamson, Rosemary Forsyth, Teresa Graves and Floy Dean. Based on the novel “Murder on the wild side” by Jeff Jacks.

results.title: Black belt Jones
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Fred Weintraub, Paul Heller and Robert Clouse
results.brief_description: Pop Boyd (Scatman Crothers) owns a thriving karate school near downtown Los Angeles. Unfortunately it sits on a piece of land upon which the local mob wants to build its own ‘civic centre’. When the gangsters’ muscling of Pop leads to tragedy, Black Belt Jones (Jim Kelly) steps forward to exact his own brand of lightning-charged revenge. Filmmaker Robert Crouse, who showcased Bruce Lee in ‘Enter the dragon’ and Jackie Chan in ‘The big brawl’, serves up masterful action sequences in which every move is choreographed like a ballet. Cast also includes Gloria Hendry, Eric Laneuville, Alan Weeks, Andre Philippe and Vincent Barbi. See also ‘Game of death’ (1978), ‘Enter the dragon’ (1973), ‘The big brawl’ (1980).

results.title: Bitter moon = Lunes de fiel
results.creator_credit: Les Films Alain Sarde, Canal+, R P Productions, Timothy Burrill Productions and Roman Polanski
results.brief_description: This dark-humored comedy drama explores perverse sexual obsession in a marriage based on mutual hatred. While on a luxury cruise to Istanbul a repressed English couple, Nigel and Fiona, (played by Hugh Grant and Kristin Scott-Thomas) meet a crippled American writer and his beautiful French wife. As the American entertains Nigel with elaborate accounts of the sexual power games he and his wife play (related in lengthy flashbacks), the English couple’s curiosity is aroused. Gradually they become drawn into their twisted and ultimately destructive relationship as unwitting observers and participants in a tragedy with the most extraordinary outcome. Cast also includes Peter Coyote and Emmanuelle Seigner.

results.title: Birdy
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, A and M Films, Alan Marshall and Allan Parker
results.brief_description: Adapted from William Wharton’s novel the film is the haunting story of one man’s obsession and another’s stubborn loyalty and support. A young man (Matthew Modine), brought up in poverty, scarred on the battlefield takes refuge in the fantasy of flight. Roaming freely through dreams and reality, against vivid backdrops of back-street Philadelphia and front-line Vietnam, the beautiful, startling photography, atmospheric music by Peter Gabriel and masterful direction of Alan Parker combine to produce an unforgettable and powerful drama that won the Special Jury Grand Prix at Cannes. Also stars Nicholas Cage.

results.title: Birdman of Alcatraz
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Stuart Millar, Guy Trosper and John Frankenheimer
results.brief_description: Robert Stroud was sentenced to serve 40 years in solitary confinement in Alcatraz. Nevertheless, he became one of the foremost authorities on birds and their diseases. His fascination and love for birds began when he nursed a sick and injured sparrow back to health. Encouraged in prison by a guard, Stroud developed his interest in birds which was strangely at odds with the harshness of the prison environment. Burt Lancaster gives an excellent performance as Stroud, Karl Malden plays the Warden, Telly Savalas is Stroud’s prison mate, Neville Brand is the prison guard and Thelma Ritter is outstanding as Stroud’s domineering mother.

results.title: Biloxi blues
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Ray Stark and Mike Nichols
results.brief_description: The year is 1943 and Eugene Morris Jerome, (Matthew Broderick), finds himself far from the comforts of his Brooklyn home when he is drafted and sent to basic training in Mississippi. Expecting to find donuts and USO dances, he instead encounters a weird and sadistic drill sergeant, (Christopher Walken), and a platoon of often hostile recruits. Armed only with his sense of humour and a quick wit, Eugene is determined to survive the rigours of army life and leave the camp with everything he came with… except his virginity. Directed by Mike Nichols, Neil Simon’s hilarious adaptation of his long-running Broadway comedy is the story of Eugene’s comical travels from adolescence to adulthood.

results.title: Billy Madison
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Robert Simonds and Tamara Davis
results.brief_description: Billy Madison’s future is made, or so he thought. He is heir to his father’s fortune, he’s passed high school compliments of his father’s cheque book, and he spends his days lazing by the pool, drinking and chasing women. His world is thrown into chaos when his father informs him of plans to hand over the family fortune, the Fortune 500 company, to vice president, and resident weasel, Eric Gordon. Billy makes a bet with his father to regain what is rightfully his. The bet is that Billy will go back to school and pass every year level within 24 weeks. Working against him is Eric, determined to retain the company, while working for him is an attractive teacher whose very interested in her new student. Cast includes Adam Sandler, Bradley Whitford, Darren McGavin and Bridgette Wilson.

results.title: Billy Liar
results.creator_credit: Vic Films, Waterhall Productions, Joseph Janni and John Schlesinger
results.brief_description: Billy Fisher lives in the rich and escapist world of his wild imagination. An irresponsible clerk in a north country town, Billy is unable to tell the truth even for two minutes. In his fantasies, Billy is a successful man of the world; in reality he gets into one scrape after another. Unable to communicate with his parents, engaged to two girls at the same time and dreaming of being a writer, Billy’s life becomes almost unbearable. Into this picture enters Liz. Her free spirit and appreciation of the creativity behind the day-dreams, offers Billy the possibility of escape. Tom Courtenay is Billy and Julie Christie is Liz in what is recognised as one of the landmark films of its decade.

results.title: Billy's Hollywood screen kiss
results.creator_credit: Revolutionary Eye, David Moseley and Tommy O'Haver
results.brief_description: Tommy O’Haver’s upbeat romantic comedy is an affectionate tribute to gay men’s affiliation and love affair with the movies and the larger than life screen passions which subsequently inform and delude romantic expectations. Aspiring photographer Billy Coller (Sean. P Hayes) is down on his luck financially and romantically. His unfortunate habit of falling for straight guys lands heterosexual model Gabriel (Brad Rowe) into his path. When Billy enlists his new found lust object into posing for a series of queer themed photos aping classic screen kisses, sexual confusion ensues. Cast includes Paul Bartel, Holly Woodlawn, Richard Ganoung and Meredith Scott Lynn.

results.title: Bill and Ted's excellent adventure
results.creator_credit: Interscope communications, Scott Kroopf, Michael S Murphey, Joel Soisson and Stephen Herek
results.brief_description: Bill (Alex Winter) and Ted (Keanu Reeves) are two teenagers who are on the verge of flunking out of high school. Acing an oral history assignment the next day is all that will spare the friends from being separated, as Ted’s draconian father is on the cusp of shipping Ted off to academy school. From the future, arrives Rufus (George Carlin), in a time travelling phone box. His mission is to give Bill and Ted the means to learn history in one night enabling them to pass their oral test. Bill and Ted rise to the challenge and ride the phone box to various times past, picking up figures of historical significance that will assist them with their presentation. Bill and Ted collect Napoleon, Joan of Arc, Socrates, Sigmund Freud, Billy the Kid and Genghis Khan. Co-written by Ed Solomon (Men in black, Charlie’s angels), “Bill and Ted’s excellent adventure”, is an example of “dude” teen humour, continued with the likes of “Wayne’s world”. Reeves and Winter are effective as the hapless dudes, equipped with their own language and logic, and a shared love of Van Halen. Directed by Stephen Herek (Mr Holland’s opus, Rock Star, Life or something like it).
